result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Kyle D. Gustum
Current: 1147 South 8th St. Apt. G, Medford, WI 54451 United States  (Effective: 03-17-2017)
Prior: 711 South Street, Medford, WI 54451 United States

Court calls case Nos. 13CF102, 15CF60, 15CF67,15CF97,16CF80.  Defendant Kyle D. Gustum in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Tlusty places agreement on the record. 15CF67 - DE enters a plea of no contest to Ct. 1 & 4.; 16CF80 - DE enters a plea of no contest to Ct. 1, 2, & 5. 16TR541 & 16TR544 - DE enters a plea of no contest to each citation.  Plea colloquy. Factual basis exists.  Court found plea given freely, voluntarily, and intelligently; accepts plea; found DE guilty.  Argument on jail sentence.  DE makes statement on sentence.  13CF102 - Court revoked Deferred Entry of Judgment on Ct. 1, withheld sentence and placed DE on probation for 3 years with the following conditions:  3 months county jail with Huber;  court costs; counseling as deemed appropriate by agent; obtain GED, HSED or High School Diploma.  15CF67 - Court withheld sentence on Ct. 1 and placed DE on probation for 3 years with the following conditions: 3 months county jail with Huber, concurrent to 13CF102; court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; payment of $25 DA service of process fees; counseling as deemed appropriate by agent; obtain GED, HSED or High School Diploma.  Ct. 4 - Court imposed court costs; DNA sample.  Court read in and dismissed Cts. 2 & 3.  15CF80 - Court withheld sentence on Ct. 1 and placed DE on probation for 3 years with the following conditions: 6 months county jail with Huber concurrent to 13CF102 & 15CF67; court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; letter of apology to Det. Balsis due within 30 days and pre-approved by agent; counseling as deemed appropriate by agent; obtain GED, HSED or High School Diploma. Ct. 2 - Court withheld sentence and placed DE on probation for 3 years with the following conditions: 12 months county jail with Huber, concurrent to Ct. 1 and 15CF67 & 13CF102; court costs; DNA sample; counseling as deemed appropriate by agent; obtain GED, HSED or High School Diploma.  Ct. 5 - Court imposed courts costs; DNA sample. Court read in, but dismissed Cts. 3 & 4.  16TR541 - Court found DE guilty and imposed the forfeiture of $213.10.  16TR544 - Court found DE guilty and imposed the forfeiture of $243.10.  Court dismissed, but read in 15CF60 and 15CF97.  Court dismissed citations 15TR722, 16TR542, & 16TR543. - ba
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 14, 2017 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Kyle D. Gustum in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Nocco waives reading of complaint.  Waive the time limits for a preliminary hearing   Bond continued.   Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  - rt
by Kyle D. Gustum

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Initial Appearance on December 15, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.
Arrest Report

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kyle D. Gustum appeared in person, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requests a  $500.00 cash bond; booking and no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Court orders a $500.00 cash bond; booking and no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Next court date is December 15, 2015 at 1:00 pm.  Attorney Tlusty requests that the clerk begin bond revocation proceedings in 13CF102, 15CF60 and 15CF67.  So ordered by the court.  The three open files are to track with the new case.  - rt
